me":"","type":"string"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"details":"Base GSN recipient contract: includes the {IRelayRecipient} interface and enables GSN support on all contracts in the inheritance tree. * TIP: This contract is abstract. The functions {IRelayRecipient-acceptRelayedCall}, {_preRelayedCall}, and {_postRelayedCall} are not implemented and must be provided by derived contracts. See the xref:ROOT:gsn-strategies.adoc#gsn-strategies[GSN strategies] for more information on how to use the pre-built {GSNRecipientSignature} and {GSNRecipientERC20Fee}, or how to write your own.","methods":{"acceptRelayedCall(address,address,bytes,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,bytes,uint256)":{"details":"Called by {IRelayHub} to validate if this recipient accepts being charged for a relayed call. Note that the recipient will be charged regardless of the execution result of the relayed call (i.e. if it reverts or not).     * The relay request was originated by `from` and will be served by `relay`. `encodedFunction` is the relayed call calldata, so its first four bytes are the function selector. The relayed call will be forwarded `gasLimit` gas, and the transaction executed with a gas price of at least `gasPrice`. `relay`'s fee is `transactionFee`, and the recipient will be charged at most `maxPossibleCharge` (in wei). `nonce` is the sender's (`from`) nonce for replay attack protection in {IRelayHub}, and `approvalData` is a optional parameter that can be used to hold a signature over all or some of the previous values.     * Returns a tuple, where the first value is used to indicate approval (0) or rejection (custom non-zero error code, values 1 to 10 are reserved) and the second one is data to be passed to the other {IRelayRecipient} functions.     * {acceptRelayedCall} is called with 50k gas: if it runs out during execution, the request will be considered rejected. A regular revert will also trigger a rejection."},"getHubAddr()":{"details":"Returns the address of the {IRelayHub} contract for this recipient."},"postRelayedCall(bytes,bool,uint256,bytes32)":{"details":"See `IRelayRecipient.postRelayedCall`.     * This function should not be overriden directly, use `_postRelayedCall` instead.     * * Requirements:     * - the caller must be the `RelayHub` contract."},"preRelayedCall(bytes)":{"details":"See `IRelayRecipient.preRelayedCall`.     * This function should not be overriden directly, use `_preRelayedCall` instead.     * * Requirements:     * - the caller must be the `RelayHub` contract."},"relayHubVersion()":{"details":"Returns the version string of the {IRelayHub} for which this recipient implementation was built. If {_upgradeRelayHub} is used, the new {IRelayHub} instance should be compatible with this version."}}},"userdoc":{"methods":{}}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"/mnt/512-2/dfd/iou-components/iou-components/contracts/GSN/GSNRecipient.sol":"GSNRecipient"},"evmVersion":"istanbul","libraries":{},"optimizer":{"enabled":false,"runs":200},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"/mnt/512-2/dfd/iou-components/iou-components/contracts/GSN/Context.sol":{"keccak256":"0x3d5cf9d00b03275ead2ef8e96e2c351771485c48a61168fce4098020eaadbd38","urls":["bzz-raw://2f550f6f69c045ce047e45fc3562de7d2faeebba06925b715d1955caeedb025b","dweb:/ipfs/QmS1i5d77WiLcT4av4LjmGSMCgo3iUQ6DUvv5phVUGrdqK"]},"/mnt/512-2/dfd/iou-components/iou-components/contracts/GSN/GSNRecipient.sol":{"keccak256":"0x3cbb798e5a4f74c4fbbe08750cb89470b2b2d522542444dcf44440ffc62a80db","urls":["bzz-raw://731fc66cafa1f345984cd668790a4b50d6dc5bd89f213e773ecefae277d2133e","dweb:/ipfs/QmcXZSUWrWMWP2TLk4BG5STHuzE64nsviKTZDJoY6M3Dej"]},"/mnt/512-2/dfd/iou-components/iou-components/contracts/GSN/IRelayHub.sol":{"keccak256":"0xf853006dfddb8dfa90d46f820a5d31ab8d43ca961d6a84800712f1c8a8a83fb0","urls":["bzz-raw://2adab84906eb727990c616bde04145636b80a3233ab38ca82b941d5e851c0edd","dweb:/ipfs/Qmf4cDSyjNTSMaGth6vyKmhq8PWRnLDhkQoTpaC5DFbSKn"]},"/mnt/512-2/dfd/iou-components/iou-components/contracts/GSN/IRelayRecipient.sol":{"keccak256":"0x411b9238141f3f9b2726fd2e3905ae0719c1f0a1c85953568c3066de467a9440","urls":["bzz-raw://ec1f123c2e90e520a423e84869773c11fe9d9830ac7b58e63c282db6cb04292a","dweb:/ipfs/QmUrLbSBV1gnaTBnt88d9svi8m7cUdvKScVLYSA8xu2YtH"]}},"version":1}

nodes.documentation:
@dev Base GSN recipient contract: includes the {IRelayRecipient} interface
and enables GSN support on all contracts in the inheritance tree.
 * TIP: This contract is abstract. The functions {IRelayRecipient-acceptRelayedCall},
 {_preRelayedCall}, and {_postRelayedCall} are not implemented and must be
provided by derived contracts. See the
xref:ROOT:gsn-strategies.adoc#gsn-strategies[GSN strategies] for more
information on how to use the pre-built {GSNRecipientSignature} and
{GSNRecipientERC20Fee}, or how to write your own.
nodes.name: GSNRecipient

nodes.documentation: @dev Emitted when a contract changes its {IRelayHub} contract to a new one.
nodes.name: RelayHubChanged

nodes.documentation: @dev Returns the address of the {IRelayHub} contract for this recipient.
nodes.name: getHubAddr

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "GSNRecipient: new RelayHub is the zero address"

arguments.value: GSNRecipient: new RelayHub is the zero address

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "GSNRecipient: new RelayHub is the zero address"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "GSNRecipient: new RelayHub is the current one"

arguments.value: GSNRecipient: new RelayHub is the current one

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "GSNRecipient: new RelayHub is the current one"

nodes.documentation:
@dev Switches to a new {IRelayHub} instance. This method is added for future-proofing: there's no reason to not
use the default instance.
     * IMPORTANT: After upgrading, the {GSNRecipient} will no longer be able to receive relayed calls from the old
{IRelayHub} instance. Additionally, all funds should be previously withdrawn via {_withdrawDeposits}.
nodes.name: _upgradeRelayHub

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns the version string of the {IRelayHub} for which this recipient implementation was built. If
{_upgradeRelayHub} is used, the new {IRelayHub} instance should be compatible with this version.
nodes.name: relayHubVersion

nodes.documentation:
@dev Withdraws the recipient's deposits in `RelayHub`.
     * Derived contracts should expose this in an external interface with proper access control.
nodes.name: _withdrawDeposits
_msgSender
_msgData

nodes.documentation:
@dev See `IRelayRecipient.preRelayedCall`.
     * This function should not be overriden directly, use `_preRelayedCall` instead.
     * * Requirements:
     * - the caller must be the `RelayHub` contract.
nodes.name: preRelayedCall
_preRelayedCall

nodes.documentation:
@dev See `IRelayRecipient.postRelayedCall`.
     * This function should not be overriden directly, use `_postRelayedCall` instead.
     * * Requirements:
     * - the caller must be the `RelayHub` contract.
nodes.name: postRelayedCall
_postRelayedCall

nodes.documentation:
@dev Return this in acceptRelayedCall to proceed with the execution of a relayed call. Note that this contract
will be charged a fee by RelayHub
nodes.name: _approveRelayedCall

nodes.documentation:
@dev See `GSNRecipient._approveRelayedCall`.
     * This overload forwards `context` to _preRelayedCall and _postRelayedCall.
nodes.name: _approveRelayedCall

nodes.documentation: @dev Return this in acceptRelayedCall to impede execution of a relayed call. No fees will be charged.
nodes.name: _rejectRelayedCall

devdoc.details: Base GSN recipient contract: includes the {IRelayRecipient} interface and enables GSN support on all contracts in the inheritance tree. * TIP: This contract is abstract. The functions {IRelayRecipient-acceptRelayedCall}, {_preRelayedCall}, and {_postRelayedCall} are not implemented and must be provided by derived contracts. See the xref:ROOT:gsn-strategies.adoc#gsn-strategies[GSN strategies] for more information on how to use the pre-built {GSNRecipientSignature} and {GSNRecipientERC20Fee}, or how to write your own.

acceptRelayedCall(address,address,bytes,.details: Called by {IRelayHub} to validate if this recipient accepts being charged for a relayed call. Note that the recipient will be charged regardless of the execution result of the relayed call (i.e. if it reverts or not).     * The relay request was originated by `from` and will be served by `relay`. `encodedFunction` is the relayed call calldata, so its first four bytes are the function selector. The relayed call will be forwarded `gasLimit` gas, and the transaction executed with a gas price of at least `gasPrice`. `relay`'s fee is `transactionFee`, and the recipient will be charged at most `maxPossibleCharge` (in wei). `nonce` is the sender's (`from`) nonce for replay attack protection in {IRelayHub}, and `approvalData` is a optional parameter that can be used to hold a signature over all or some of the previous values.     * Returns a tuple, where the first value is used to indicate approval (0) or rejection (custom non-zero error code, values 1 to 10 are reserved) and the second one is data to be passed to the other {IRelayRecipient} functions.     * {acceptRelayedCall} is called with 50k gas: if it runs out during execution, the request will be considered rejected. A regular revert will also trigger a rejection.

getHubAddr().details: Returns the address of the {IRelayHub} contract for this recipient.

postRelayedCall(bytes,bool,uint256,bytes.details: See `IRelayRecipient.postRelayedCall`.     * This function should not be overriden directly, use `_postRelayedCall` instead.     * * Requirements:     * - the caller must be the `RelayHub` contract.

preRelayedCall(bytes).details: See `IRelayRecipient.preRelayedCall`.     * This function should not be overriden directly, use `_preRelayedCall` instead.     * * Requirements:     * - the caller must be the `RelayHub` contract.

relayHubVersion().details: Returns the version string of the {IRelayHub} for which this recipient implementation was built. If {_upgradeRelayHub} is used, the new {IRelayHub} instance should be compatible with this version.
